title: Herbie Hancock Headhunters Record Tittle Type
content:
Hi, can you help me out a little bit. I’m trying to figure out is that some font or close to some font. Seems like it could be hand drawn. But who knows if i might get lucky. Thanks for advance dudes and dudettes. :)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [HH.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081017105315/http:/typophile.com/files/HH.jpg) | 30.35 KB |

 [‹ UGANDA Soccer Tee](http://web.archive.org/web/20081017105315/http:/www.typophile.com/node/49722 "Go to previous forum topic") [Club Flyer Type ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081017105315/http:/www.typophile.com/node/50550 "Go to next forum topic")
author: ABCDEFG

comments.content:
I tought some one could help out. :(  
Maby too tough ID?

Cheerios,

ABCDEFG

This is hand drawn. The E in Head and E in Hunters are quite different. So are the two Cs in Hancock. Also the A in Head and A in Hancock. I can’t think of anything similar. Searching for a word like “tribal” on myfonts might get you something. I don’t know if dafont does a similar keyword search.

I agree that this was probably hand drawn, but it seems to be modeled after an old face called Japanette, which you can find on some of the free font sites (I don’t think there is a commercial version.)

BIG THANKS for your help! This really helps me a lot. Just wanted to see what the missing character forms looked like.  
I’ll probably have to do some tweaking of my own but thats not a big deal.

I knew I can trust you guys in this forum. :D

You take care,

ABCDEFG
